question: I'm concerned for my mother whom in 2005 had upper left lobe removal due to "unidentified lung infection" of 3 inches in mass, not cm!  Several cultures rule out cancer, TB,pneumonia, etc.  They can tell what it "isn't" but don't know what it "is".  Now 10/07 CT shows 8-10 new spots forming on Upper Right Lobe, new emergence LL Lobe, and 1 spot Center Right Lobe.  Bronchopsy with good washings done several weeks ago, and nothing grows on cultures. The only thing left now, is to wait several more weeks to see what happens with FDG uptake test.  I am very concerned because my mother's primary disease is Type 1 Diabetes x20 yrs, she feels somewhat low energy but walks & moderate excercise.  But 3" mass taken out in 2005 was never identified, and now it's back again!  The surgery in 2005 was excruciating for her.  They believe it's bacterial, but what possiblities could it be?  Frustrated.
title: What Lung Infection Could this be?
